Docs.summary: SharedMemory enables the creation, mapping, and protection control over anonymous shared memory.

remarks.para: SharedMemory enables the creation, mapping, and protection control over anonymous shared memory.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed
abstract member Close : unit -> unit override this.Close : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Close the backing FileDescriptor of this SharedMemory instance.

remarks.para: Close the backing FileDescriptor of this SharedMemory instance. Note that all open mappings of the shared memory will remain valid and may continue to be used. The shared memory will not be freed until all file descriptor handles are closed and all memory mappings are unmapped.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function Create (name As String, size As Integer) As SharedMemory
public: static Android::OS::SharedMemory ^ Create(System::String ^ name, int size);
public static Android.OS.SharedMemory Create (string? name, int size);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.OS.SharedMemory Create(string name, int32 size) cil managed
static member Create : string * int -> Android.OS.SharedMemory

Docs.param: The debug name to use for this SharedMemory instance. This can be null, however a debug name is recommended to help identify memory usage when using tools such as lsof or examining /proc/[pid]/maps
The size of the shared memory to create. Must be greater than 0.
Docs.summary: Creates an anonymous SharedMemory instance with the provided debug name and size.
Docs.returns: A SharedMemory instance of the requested size

remarks.para: Creates an anonymous SharedMemory instance with the provided debug name and size. The name is only used for debugging purposes and can help identify what the shared memory is used for when inspecting memory maps for the processes that have mapped this SharedMemory instance.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function FromFileDescriptor (fd As ParcelFileDescriptor) As SharedMemory
.method public static hidebysig class Android.OS.SharedMemory FromFileDescriptor(class Android.OS.ParcelFileDescriptor fd) cil managed

Docs.param: File descriptor of shared memory passed as ParcelFileDescriptor.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance from existing shared memory passed as ParcelFileDescriptor.

remarks.para: Creates an instance from existing shared memory passed as ParcelFileDescriptor.
The fd should be a shared memory created from SharedMemory or ASharedMemory. This can be useful when shared memory is passed as file descriptor through JNI or binder service implemented in cpp.

Note that newly created SharedMemory takes ownership of passed fd and the original fd becomes detached (Check ParcelFileDescriptor#detachFd()). If the caller wants to use the file descriptor after the call, the caller should duplicate the file descriptor (Check ParcelFileDescriptor#dup()) and pass the duped version instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function Map (prot As Integer, offset As Integer, length As Integer) As ByteBuffer
public: Java::Nio::ByteBuffer ^ Map(int prot, int offset, int length);
public Java.Nio.ByteBuffer Map (int prot, int offset, int length);
.method public hidebysig instance class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer Map(int32 prot, int32 offset, int32 length) cil managed
member this.Map : int * int * int -> Java.Nio.ByteBuffer

Docs.param: A bitwise-or'd combination of PROT_READ, PROT_WRITE, PROT_EXEC, or PROT_NONE.
The offset into the shared memory to begin mapping. Must be >= 0 and less than getSize().
The length of the region to map. Must be > 0 and offset + length must not exceed getSize().
Docs.summary: Creates an mmap of the SharedMemory with the specified prot, offset, and length.

remarks.para: Creates an mmap of the SharedMemory with the specified prot, offset, and length. This will always produce a new ByteBuffer window to the backing shared memory region. Every call to map() may be paired with a call to #unmap(ByteBuffer) when the ByteBuffer returned by map() is no longer needed.

format.a: Java documentation for android.os.SharedMemory.map(int, int, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer MapReadOnly() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a read-only mapping of the entire shared memory region.

remarks.para:
Creates a read-only mapping of the entire shared memory region. This requires the the protection level of the shared memory is at least PROT_READ or the map will fail.
Use #map(int, int, int) to have more control over the mapping if desired. This is equivalent to map(OsConstants.PROT_READ, 0, getSize())
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer MapReadWrite() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a read/write mapping of the entire shared memory region.

remarks.para:
Creates a read/write mapping of the entire shared memory region. This requires the the protection level of the shared memory is at least PROT_READ|PROT_WRITE or the map will fail.
Use #map(int, int, int) to have more control over the mapping if desired. This is equivalent to map(OsConstants.PROT_READ | OsConstants.PROT_WRITE, 0, getSize())
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetProtect (prot As Integer) As Boolean
.method public hidebysig instance bool SetProtect(int32 prot) cil managed

Docs.param: Any bitwise-or'ed combination of android.system.OsConstants#PROT_READ, android.system.OsConstants#PROT_WRITE, and android.system.OsConstants#PROT_EXEC; or android.system.OsConstants#PROT_NONE
Docs.summary: Sets the protection on the shared memory to the combination specified in prot, which is either a bitwise-or'd combination of android.system.OsConstants#PROT_READ, android.system.OsConstants#PROT_WRITE, android.system.OsConstants#PROT_EXEC from android.system.OsConstants, or android.system.OsConstants#PROT_NONE, to remove all further access.
Docs.returns: Whether or not the requested protection was applied. Returns true on success, false if the requested protection was broader than the existing protection.

remarks.para:
Sets the protection on the shared memory to the combination specified in prot, which is either a bitwise-or'd combination of android.system.OsConstants#PROT_READ, android.system.OsConstants#PROT_WRITE, android.system.OsConstants#PROT_EXEC from android.system.OsConstants, or android.system.OsConstants#PROT_NONE, to remove all further access.
Note that protection can only ever be removed, not added. By default shared memory is created with protection set to PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE | PROT_EXEC. The protection passed here also only applies to any mappings created after calling this method. Existing mmaps of the shared memory retain whatever protection they had when they were created.
A common usage of this is to share a read-only copy of the data with something else. To do that first create the read/write mapping with PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, then call setProtect(PROT_READ) to remove write capability, then send the SharedMemory to another process. That process will only be able to mmap with PROT_READ.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Sub Unmap (buffer As ByteBuffer)
.method public static hidebysig void Unmap(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer buffer) cil managed

Docs.summary: Unmaps a buffer previously returned by #map(int, int, int).

remarks.para: Unmaps a buffer previously returned by #map(int, int, int). This will immediately release the backing memory of the ByteBuffer, invalidating all references to it. Only call this method if there are no duplicates of the ByteBuffer in use and don't access the ByteBuffer after calling this method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
